intro: Hieracium gardsbyense, commonly known as the Gardsby meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers with a central disc, and its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem. Hieracium gardsbyense is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich soils.
